body_content.explanation: a kind of lichen (= a plant-like organism) that is eaten by reindeer (= a type of deer with large horns) and whose stems and branches are said to look similar to reindeer horns:
examples: The reindeer paw at the snow to reach the reindeer moss below.
Better-drained uplands have a ground cover of grey-green lichens, notably reindeer mosses.
Like all lichen, reindeer lichen consists of two organisms, fungus and algae, that have a symbiotic relationship.
